bill_title: Honoring Mrs. Laura Kuper on her ninety-seventh birthday.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Mrs. Laura Kuper on her ninety-seventh birthday. WHEREAS, Laura Kuper was born on a farm nine miles north of Worthing, South Dakota, on February 15, 1916, to Fred and Bertha (Reamers) Mausbach; and WHEREAS, Laura married John Kuper on July 2, 1932; and WHEREAS, Laura and John farmed until their children were grown and then moved to Sacramento, California. While living in Sacramento, Laura became a Certified Librarian and development curriculum for school systems at a district resource center for training library clerks; and WHEREAS, Laura and John raised four children, and have twelve grandchildren and nine great grandchildren: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eighty-Eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Mrs. Laura Kuper be honored on her ninety-seventh birthday.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Mrs. Laura Kuper on her ninety-seventh birthday. WHEREAS, Laura Kuper was born on a farm nine miles north of Worthing, South Dakota, on February 15, 1916, to Fred and Bertha (Reamers) Mausbach; and WHEREAS, Laura married John Kuper on July 2, 1932; and WHEREAS, Laura and John farmed until their children were grown and then moved to Sacramento, California. While living in Sacramento, Laura became a Certified Librarian and development curriculum for school systems at a district resource center for training library clerks; and WHEREAS, Laura and John raised four children, and have twelve grandchildren and nine great grandchildren: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eighty-Eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Mrs. Laura Kuper be honored on her ninety-seventh birthday. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
